Advanced ASIC Design & Verification

Master SystemVerilog and UVM to verify IP, subsystems, and SoCs. Build testbenches, assertions, coverage, and regressions on industry‑style designs.

Skills Covered

  • SystemVerilog & UVM
  • Assertions (SVA), functional & code coverage
  • Constrained‑random & directed testing
  • VIP integration, scoreboards, checkers
  • Regressions, debug & coverage closure

Projects

  • APB/AXI VIP with assertions & coverage
  • NoC Router Design & Verification
  • RISC‑V Verification + FPGA realization
  • I2C/SPI/UART with error injection

Job Roles

  • Design Verification Engineer
  • VIP Engineer
  • UVM Methodology Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Junior DV → DV Engineer → Senior DV → DV Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

Physical Design

Learn digital back‑end flow from floorplanning through sign‑off. Practice timing closure, power optimization, DRC/LVS, and ECO methodologies.

Skills Covered

  • Floorplanning, placement, clock‑tree synthesis
  • Routing, optimization, congestion analysis
  • STA, timing closure, MCMM
  • DRC/LVS, antenna, IR/EM checks
  • ECO flows & tape‑out readiness

Projects

  • Block‑level PnR and timing closure
  • CTS & skew optimization
  • ECO implementation & sign‑off checks

Job Roles

  • Physical Design Engineer
  • STA Engineer
  • Sign‑off/Integration Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. PD → PD Engineer → Sr. PD → PD Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

FPGA‑Based System Design

Design, integrate, and validate FPGA subsystems using Verilog/SystemVerilog and vendor IP. Implement DMA/AXI pipelines and real‑time processing on boards.

Skills Covered

  • RTL coding, constraints & timing
  • IP integration, AXI/DMA, memory‑mapped I/O
  • On‑board debug (ILA/Chipscope)
  • Image/signal processing & acceleration

Projects

  • ISP pipeline on FPGA
  • AXI DMA frame buffer & display
  • DDR4, PCIe, ADC/DAC, Camera Interface
  • Realtime image signal processing

Job Roles

  • FPGA Design/Validation Engineer
  • Hardware Accelerator Engineer
  • Prototyping/Bring‑up Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. FPGA → FPGA Engineer → Sr. FPGA → Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

Advanced Embedded Systems Design

Develop firmware for microcontrollers and embedded Linux. Build drivers, RTOS tasks, connectivity stacks, and production‑grade diagnostics.

Skills Covered

  • Embedded C/C++, HALs, peripheral drivers
  • RTOS (tasks, queues, ISRs)
  • Bootloaders, firmware update & logging
  • Linux drivers, Yocto basics, device tree
  • Connectivity: UART/SPI/I2C, BLE/Wi‑Fi/IoT

Projects

  • Sensor hub with RTOS & low‑power modes
  • STM32 driver suite with unit tests
  • Linux char driver with sysfs & ioctl
  • Jetson AI accel, Qt apps, CUDA basics

Job Roles

  • Embedded Firmware Engineer
  • Device Driver Engineer
  • Embedded Linux Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. ES → ES Engineer → Sr. ES → Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

Analog Circuit Design

Design core analog IP and validate performance across corners. Practice low‑noise, low‑power techniques and mixed‑signal integration.

Skills Covered

  • CMOS, biasing, op‑amps, comparators
  • Bandgaps, LDOs, PLL basics
  • Noise, mismatch, Monte‑Carlo & corners
  • Layout‑aware design & parasitics
  • Mixed‑signal verification hand‑off

Projects

  • Two‑stage op‑amp with compensation
  • Low‑power comparator with hysteresis
  • Simple PLL behavioral model

Job Roles

  • Analog Design Engineer
  • Mixed‑Signal Integration Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. Analog → Analog Engineer → Sr. Analog → Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

Analog Layout Design

Create robust custom layouts with matching, shielding, and parasitic awareness. Achieve clean DRC/LVS and reliable extraction for sign‑off.

Skills Covered

  • Device matching, common‑centroid techniques
  • Guard rings, shielding, routing strategies
  • DRC/LVS closure, PEX & EM/IR basics
  • Floorplanning for analog macros

Projects

  • Matched differential pair & current mirror
  • Capacitor array with DNL/INL
  • Post‑layout PEX verification

Job Roles

  • Analog Layout Engineer
  • Custom Layout/Physical Verification Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. Layout → Layout Engineer → Sr. Layout → Lead

Apply for This Course
← Back to All Courses

DIGITAL-VERILOG

Learn digital design fundamentals. Practice timing closure, power optimization, DRC/LVS, and ECO methodologies.

Skills Covered

  • Floorplanning, placement, clock‑tree synthesis
  • Routing, optimization, congestion analysis
  • STA, timing closure, MCMM
  • DRC/LVS, antenna, IR/EM checks
  • ECO flows & tape‑out readiness

Projects

  • Block‑level PnR and timing closure
  • CTS & skew optimization
  • ECO implementation & sign‑off checks

Job Roles

  • Physical Design Engineer
  • STA Engineer
  • Sign‑off/Integration Engineer

Career Pathway

Trainee → Jr. PD → PD Engineer → Sr. PD → PD Lead
